member.name: T:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3
member.summary: Generic base class of . This class was created to preserve the compatibility with clouds created before the Cloud System dll's were used.
member.exception: Is thrown when an editor only operation is called while the application is playing.

member.name: F:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.verticalColors
member.summary: Vertical colors are used by renderers which support that specific functionality. If the size of this array is changed or any in it, you have to call to get valid results. If the vertical colors are not sorted, it is necessary to call first. There always have to be at least two element. One with a of 0.0f, and one with a of 1.0f. All other vertical factors have to be values from [0.0f, 1.0f]. It is not allowed that there are two identical vertical factors.

member.name: F:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.shadingGroups
member.summary: Shading groups are used by renderers which support that specific functionality. Every particle belongs to a shading group, that's why you have to make sure, that this array contains enough shading groups. If you manipulate the of a shading group, you need to update the too. Use for that.

member.name: F:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.shadingColors
member.summary: Shading colors are used by renderers which support shading groups. if the size of this array is changed or any in it, you have to call to get valid results. If the shading colors are not sorted, it is necessary to call first. There always have to be at least two elements. One with a of -1.0f, and one with a of 1.0f. All other shading factors have to be values from [-1.0f, 1.0f]. It is not allowed that there are two identical shading factors.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ParticleData
member.summary: Particles are structs and can not be serialized directly in Unity. That's the reason why we have this particle data. It is only intended to be used in the editor and for the initialization at runtime.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CloudRendererData
member.summary: Gets the cloud renderer data for multithreading.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CreatorData
member.summary: All kinds of data, that is only used in the Editor to create the clouds, is available in here.
member.exception: Is thrown when this operation is called while the application is playing.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CloudRendererType
member.summary: Special enum for the renderer type. It is only used in the Editor.
member.value: The type of the cloud renderer.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CloudRenderer
member.summary: Renderer that is used for this cloud. It is not possible to change the renderer at runtime. It needs to be changed in the Editor.
member.exception: Is thrown when this operation is called while the application is playing.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.IsInitialized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is initialized.
member.value: true if this instance is initialized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SupportsNonSquaredParticles
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this supports non squared particles.
member.value: true if supports non squared particles; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SupportsVerticalColors
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this supports vertical colors.
member.value: true if supports vertical colors; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SupportsShadingGroups
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this supports shading groups.
member.value: true if supports shading groups; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SupportsTint
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this supports tint.
member.value: true if supports tint; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ParticleMaterial
member.summary: Material used to render the particles.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.XTile
member.summary: The number of columns into which the particle material is splitted. This value has to be strictly greater than zero.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.YTile
member.summary: The number of rows into which the particle material is splitted. This has to be strictly greater than zero.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.TileCount
member.summary: The number of particle sprites that are available in the particle material.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.Tint
member.summary: Base color of the cloud. If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.UseParticleColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should be used for the cloud shading.
member.value: true if use particle color; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.VerticalShadingInfluence
member.summary: For renderers which support both vertical colors and shading groups, you may change the amount by which they are visible. This value has to be in the range [0.0f, 1.0f]. By changing this value, the other influence factor gets manipulated too, such that the sum of them is exactly one. If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ShadingGroupInfluence
member.summary: For renderers which support both vertical colors and shading groups, you may change the amount by which they are visible. This value has to be in the range [0.0f, 1.0f]. By changing this value, the other influence factor gets manipulated too, such that the sum of them is exactly one. If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.Scale
member.exception: Is thrown when the setter is called while the application is playing.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.Fading
member.summary: A simple fading factor for the cloud. I has to be in [0.0f, 1.0f]. By changing this value, both the core particle transparency and the non core particle transparency are going to be changed. If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CoreParticleTransparency
member.summary: The core particle transparency controls the visibility of particles which have the core flag set to true. The value has to be in the range [0.0f, 1.0f]. Changing this value overrides any previous setting made using . If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.NonCoreParticleTransparency
member.summary: The non core particle transparency controls the visibility of particles which have the core flag set to false. The value has to be in the range [0.0f, 1.0f]. Changing this value overrides any previous setting made using . If this value is changed, all particles are going to be recalculated.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.CachedTransform
member.summary: Cached transform to slightly increase the performance.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.MeshScale
member.summary: Gets the mesh scale for the workaround.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ParticleSystemScale
member.summary: Gets the particle system scale for the workaround.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.BoundingBox
member.summary: Bounding box of the cloud in local space.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.Sun
member.summary: Transform of the object that is used as sun for the shading group rendering. This reference is not allowed to be null, if a renderer is used that supports shading groups.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ParticleCount
member.summary: Number of particles this cloud consists of. This value is intended to be used at runtime.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.TransformMatrix
member.summary: Transform matrix that is used by the custom renderers.
member.returns: The transform matrix of this cloud. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.UnscaledTransformMatrix
member.summary: Unscaled transform matrix of the cloud.
member.returns: The unscaled transform matrix of this cloud. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.RecalculateBoundingBox
member.summary: If the particle position or size is changed, such that the current bounding box is not anymore valid, this method has to be called in order to get correct visual results.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.AreVerticalColorsSorted
member.summary: Checks if the array is sorted.
member.returns: Returns true, if is sorted. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SortVerticalColors
member.summary: Sort the array.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.HeightToVerticalFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: Convert a scaled height within the cloud to a vertical factor that can be used to calculate a vertical color. It is necessary that the bounding box of this cloud had a height that was strictly greater than zero when was called the last time.
member.param: Height within the cloud. The height should be within the bounding box in order to get a valid result. A
member.returns: Factor that is usable to calculate the actual color at the height using . If a height is a valid height in the bounding box, the result is going to be in [0.0f, 1.0f]. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.VerticalColorAt(System.Single)
member.summary: The color we get for the given vertical factor using the array. It is necessary that was set up correctly in order to get valid results.
member.param: Height factor that can be calculated using . This value has to be in [0.0f, 1.0f]. A
member.returns: Color for the given vertical factor. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.RecalculateVerticalColorFactors
member.summary: Recalculate factors that are based on and are needed for the correct results. This operation is only allowed to be called, if is valid according to its description.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.AreShadingColorsSorted
member.summary: Checks if the array is sorted.
member.returns: Returns true, if is sorted. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SortShadingColors
member.summary: Sort the array.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ShadingColorAt(System.Single)
member.summary: The color we get for the given shading factor using the array. It is necessary that was set up correctly in order to get valid results.
member.param: Shading factor is intended to be calculated in the renderer. It is the scalar product of the normalized sun direction with the normalized vector from the scaled shading group center to a certain position in the cloud, for which the color is calculated. This valud has to be in [-1.0f, 1.0f]. A
member.returns: Color for the given shading factor. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.RecalculateShadingColorFactors
member.summary: Recalculate factors that are based on and are needed for the correct results. This operation is only allowed to be called, if is valid according to its description.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.RecalculateScaledShadingGroupCenters
member.summary: Recalculate the scaled centers for all shading groups.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.ParticleAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the particle from this cloud at index. This method is indended to be used at runtime only. Editor scripts preferably use instead.
member.param: The position at which the wanted particle is. This value has to be in [0, - 1]. A
member.returns: Particle at index from this cloud. A

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.Cloud`3.SetParticleAt(System.Int32,Edelweiss.CloudSystem.CloudParticle)
member.summary: Set the particle to this cloud at index. This method is intended to be used at runtime only. Editor scripts preferably use instead.
member.param: The position at which the particle is set. This value has to be in [0, ParticleCount - 1]. A
The particle that has to be set at index. A

member.summary: Raises the enable event.

member.name: T:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.CloudBase
member.summary: Base class for the generic class. This class was created to preserve the compatibility with clouds created before the Cloud System dll's were used.

member.name: P:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.CloudBase.Scale
member.summary: Scale of this cloud. You can not change this value at runtime. Instead you have to iterate through all particles and multiply the position and particle size by the needed factor. The scale is not allowed to be smaller than zero.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.CloudBase.SetParticleSystemHasChanged
member.summary: This method tells the renderer that all particles need to be recalculated. It is mostly called automatically, such that you don't have to deal with it. But there are two exceptions. If you make changes in 'verticalColors' or 'shadingColors', you have to call this method in order to update the cloud's particles.

member.summary: Threaded quick sort.

member.summary: All objects that are needed for multithreading are reused to make the life of the garbage collector easier.

member.summary: Threaded quick sort for a certain range.
member.param: This has to be a instance with valid members.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.QuickSort`1.Sort(T[])
member.summary: Sequential quick sort.
member.param: Array to be sorted. It is not allowed to be null.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.QuickSort`1.SequentialSort(T[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sequential quick sort for a certain range.
member.param: Array to be sorted. It is not allowed to be null.
Smallest index of the range that is sorted. It has to be a valid index of the array.
Greatest index of the range that is sorted. It has to be a valid index of the array.

member.name: M:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.QuickSort`1.SwapElements(T[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Swap two elements of the array.
member.param: Array in which the elements are swapped. It is not allowed to be null.
First index of an element that is swapped. It has to be a valid index of the array.
Second index of an element that is swapped. It has to be a valid index of the array.

member.name: T:Edelweiss.CloudSystem.QuickSortThreadArguments`1
member.summary: Arguments need to be bundled for the threading.
